Aktifkan Ponsel dalam Pesawat, Bahaya Nggak Sih?
04 Nov 2019, 22:27 by Kris Fathoni W


Aktifkan Ponsel dalam Pesawat, Bahaya Nggak Sih? (Foto: iStock)

Jakarta - Di awal setiap penerbangan, penumpang pesawat lazim diingatkan untuk mematikan ponselnya atau mengaktifkan airplane/flight mode (mode pesawat). Apakah mengaktifkan ponsel di pesawat sedemikian berbahaya?Topik itu sendiri sejatinya relatif banyak diperdebatkan semenjak penggunaan telepon seluler, secara khusus di era smartphone, kian jamak ditemui termasuk di kalangan para penumpang pesawat.Untuk menjawab pertanyaan apakah mengaktifkan ponsel di pesawat berbahaya atau tidak, media Inggris Express.co.uk mengutip penuturan dari Patrick Smith, seorang pilot yang juga penulis buku Cockpit Confidential."Apakah komunikasi seluler mengganggu peralatan di kokpit? Jawabannya, secara potensi ya tapi kemungkinan besar tidak," tulis Smith seperti dilansir Express.co.uk.Menurut Smith, pihak maskapai penerbangan sudah mengantisipasi gangguan sinyal dari ponsel yang berpotensi mengganggu instrumen penerbangan di dalam pesawat. Tapi maskapai juga tak mau ambil risiko sekecil apapun potensi gangguan yang dapat diakibatkan ponsel.


Ilustrasi kokpit pesawat. (Foto: iStock)

"Walaupun tidak sedang digunakan untuk menelepon, ponsel aktif mengirimkan kumpulan energi yang secara teori dapat mengganggu piranti elektronik di pesawat. Tapi badan pesawat sebenarnya sudah dirancang dan dilapisi untuk mengantisipasi gangguan tersebut dan hal itu dapat mencegah efek buruknya," ucapnya."(Namun) sejauh ini maskapai dan regulator sudah mengadopsi kebijakan tanpa toleransi, yakni lebih baik berjaga-jaga ketimbang menyesal belakangan," tutur Smith menegaskan.Smith juga menyebut, saat ini larangan penggunaan ponsel dalam pesawat yang tengah mengudara juga sudah lebih fleksibel ketimbang beberapa tahun sebelumnya."Kini situasi sudah berbeda. Di AS, FAA masih membatasi penggunaan ponsel lewat kehadiran mode pesawat, tapi berkirim pesan dan menelepon via Wi-Fi sekarang sudah diizinkan," ujarnya.


Ilustrasi penggunan ponsel dalam pesawat. (Foto: Unspslah)

Ia juga memberikan sedikit penjelasan teknis terkait sinyal ponsel di pesawat, terkait keberadaan "stasiun pemancar mini" yang sudah onboard di dalam pesawat."Di udara, panggilan pada ponsel akan terhubung pada sesuatu yang disebut 'picocell', sebuah miniatur base station dalam pesawat. Picocells mengurangi energi yang dipancarkan ponsel Anda dan kemudian merelai sinyalnya via satelit atau ke menara telekomunikasi tertentu yang sudah terkonfigurasi," katanya.Secara pribadi, Smith juga menyebut bahwa restriksi terhadap penggunaan ponsel dalam pesawat yang sedang mengudara pun tetap punya manfaat besar. Ia pun mengingatkan betapa ramai dan padatnya sinyal telekomunikasi di bandara, yang diakibatkan oleh ponsel."Bombardir sensor di dalam bandara sudah sedemikian luar biasa. Kabin pesawat terbang adalah tempat terakhir yang relatif masih sunyi (asalkan tak ada bayi yang sedang menangis). Jadi sebaiknya kita pertahankan agar tetap seperti itu," sebut Smith.Halaman1 Tampilkan Semua Artikel Selanjutnya Teriak Pesawat Akan Jatuh, Penumpang Diturunkan di Tengah Jalan(krs/aff)

Activate Cellphone in Airplane, Is It Dangerous?
Nov 04 2019, 22:27 by Kris Fathoni W


Activate Cellphone in Airplane, Is It Dangerous? (Photo: iStock)

Jakarta - At the beginning of every flight, airplane passengers are usually reminded to turn off their cellphones or activate airplane / flight mode. Is activating cellphones on airplanes so dangerous? The topic itself is actually relatively much debated since the use of cell phones, specifically in the smartphone era, increasingly common among passengers, including airplanes. To answer the question whether activating cellphones on aircraft is dangerous or not, the British media Express.co.uk quoted from Patrick Smith, a pilot who is also the author of the Cockpit Confidential book, "Is cellular communication disrupting equipment in the cockpit? The answer, potentially yes but most likely no," Smith wrote as reported by Express.co.uk. According to Smith, the airlines had anticipated signal interference from cellphones that could potentially disrupt flight instruments on the plane. But airlines also don't want to take the slightest risk of potential interference that can be caused by cellphones.


Illustration of aircraft cockpit. (Photo: iStock)

"Even though it is not being used to make calls, cellphones actively transmit a collection of energy which in theory can disrupt electronic devices on the plane. But the fuselage has actually been designed and coated to anticipate such interference and it can prevent its adverse effects," he said. So far the airlines and regulators have adopted a zero tolerance policy, which is better on guard rather than regret later, "Smith stressed. Smith also said, at this time the ban on the use of cell phones in airplanes was also more flexible than in previous years." "The situation is different now. In the US, the FAA still limits cell phone use through the presence of airplane mode, but texting and calling via Wi-Fi is now permitted," he said.


Illustration of using a cellphone in an airplane. (Photo: Unspslah)

He also gave a little technical explanation related to cellphone signals on the plane, related to the existence of "mini transmitting stations" that were already onboard in the plane. "In the air, calls on cellphones will be connected to something called 'picocell', a miniature base station in the aircraft. Picocells reduce the energy emitted by your cellphone and then relay the signal via satellite or to certain configured telecommunication towers, "he said. Personally, Smith also mentioned that restrictions on cell phone use in airplanes are still having great benefits. He also reminded how crowded and crowded the telecommunications signals at the airport, which are caused by cellphones. "Sensor bombardments inside the airport have been so extraordinary. The aircraft cabin is the last place that is still relatively quiet (provided there are no babies crying). we keep it that way, "Smith said.
